chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Carlos Espana was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $100 fine plus costs. Paid in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Carlos Espana

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Juan Carlos Espana in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Court imposes sentence. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Juan Carlos Espana appeared by phone. Attorney Brett E Reetz appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests plea hearing, advises that Defendant is in Virginia.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Juan Carlos Espana appeared by phone. Attorney Brett E Reetz appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of additional issues to be discussed with State, including immigration issues, requests 30 days. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2017 at 02:15 pm.
No violent contact direct or indirect with AT. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Juan Carlos Espana in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense enters not guilty plea. Defense requests status in 60 days, requests phone appearance for himself and Defendant, who lives in Virginia. State has no objection. If resolved, parties will notify the Court.  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Juan Carlos Espana and attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt appeared by phone. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. State reviews status of case, does not feel that Court has jurisdiction over client. Defense advises that Defendant could appear with a couple weeks notice of date. State proposes how to proceed. Court advises that Defendant must be present for next hearing.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 9, 2017 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Juan Carlos Espana
Current: 409 Tapestry Park Drive, #821, Chesapeake, VA 23320 United States  (Effective: 11-14-2016)
Prior: 621 N Elgin Place, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235
Initial appearance on November 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Cash bond posted, Court date scheduled for 11/14/16, 10:00.

In lieu of bringing defendant's body before this court, defendant may post a cash bond of $500 to the Arresting Agency. Said cash bond then to be forwarded to Door County Clerk of Court, 1205 S. Duluth Avenue, Sturgeon Bay, WI  54235. If cash bond is posted, prior to defendant's release, the Arresting Agency shall give notice to defendant of his/her next court date, which date shall be provided by the Issuing Agency.
